verses.roman:
jāmadagnyo ’pi bhagavān
rāmaḥ kamala-locanaḥ
āgāminy antare rājan
vartayiṣyati vai bṛhat

synonyms: jāmadagnyaḥ—the son of Jamadagni; api—also; bhagavān—the Personality of Godhead; rāmaḥ—Lord Paraśurāma; kamala-locanaḥ—whose eyes are like lotus petals; āgāmini—coming; antare—in the manvantara, the time of one Manu; rājan—O King Parīkṣit; vartayiṣyati—will propound; vai—indeed; bṛhat—Vedic knowledge.
translation: My dear King Parīkṣit, in the next manvantara the lotus-eyed Personality of Godhead Lord Paraśurāma, the son of Jamadagni, will be a great propounder of Vedic knowledge. In other words, he will be one of the seven sages.
